title: United Kingdom Model for End-Stage Liver Disease (UKELD)
description: Predicts mortality in end-stage liver disease patients for liver transplant planning. Developed specifically for UK population to determine eligibility for liver transplantation and estimate patient prognosis.

parameters.name: inr
parameters.description: International Normalized Ratio (INR) - measure of blood clotting time

parameters.name: creatinine_umol_l
parameters.description: Serum creatinine concentration in micromoles per liter

parameters.name: bilirubin_umol_l
parameters.description: Serum bilirubin concentration in micromoles per liter

parameters.name: sodium_mmol_l
parameters.description: Serum sodium concentration in millimoles per liter

result.name: ukeld_score
result.description: UKELD score predicting mortality risk in end-stage liver disease

ranges.interpretation: UKELD score below 49 indicates relatively low 1-year mortality risk (<9% without transplantation). Patient does not meet the UK criteria for liver transplant eligibility based on mortality risk alone. Continue medical management and monitor disease progression.

UKELD score ≥49 meets the UK cutoff for transplant eligibility, indicating >9% 1-year mortality risk without transplantation. Patient should be evaluated for liver transplantation and placed on the waiting list if appropriate. Optimize medical management while awaiting transplant.

UKELD score ≥60 predicts approximately 50% 1-year mortality risk without transplantation. Patient has very high priority for liver transplantation. Urgent transplant evaluation and aggressive supportive care are indicated. Consider intensive care unit monitoring if clinically unstable.

references: Neuberger J, Gimson A, Davies M, Akyol M, O'Grady J, Burroughs A, Hudson M. Selection of patients for liver transplantation and allocation of donated livers in the UK. Gut. 2008;57(2):252-7.

Barber K, Madden S, Allen J, Collett D, Neuberger J, Gimson A. Elective liver transplant list mortality: development of a United Kingdom end-stage liver disease score. Transplantation. 2011;92(4):469-76.
formula: UKELD Score = 5.395 × ln(INR) + 1.485 × ln(creatinine, µmol/L) + 3.13 × ln(bilirubin, µmol/L) - 81.565 × ln(sodium, mmol/L) + 435
notes: Developed specifically for the UK population based on data from UK liver transplantation centers (2003-2007)
Score ≥49 is the cutoff for transplant eligibility in the UK, corresponding to >9% 1-year mortality without transplantation
Score of 60 predicts approximately 50% 1-year mortality without transplantation
Excludes patients with hepatocellular carcinoma, who may qualify for transplantation through other criteria
Interlaboratory differences in laboratory values may affect score accuracy
Based on natural logarithm calculations - ensure all laboratory values are positive and within physiological ranges
Used in conjunction with clinical assessment and other factors to determine transplant candidacy
Originally derived from the MELD score but incorporates serum sodium and uses UK-specific coefficients
